lead_paragraph: Stung by criticism of its all-white Oscar nominations, the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences said it would overhaul its structure to increase diversity.

byline.contributor: Cara Buckley contributed reporting from Park City, Utah; Rachel Donadio from Paris; and Lorne Manly and Melena Ryzik from New York.

headline.print_headline: Oscars to Lead by Example on Diversity
headline.main: Academy Board Endorses Changes to Increase Diversity in Oscar Nominees and Itself

snippet: Stung by criticism of its all-white Oscar nominations, the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences said it would overhaul its structure to increase diversity.
abstract: Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences announces it is overhauling its structure and processes after overwhelmingly white field of nominees led to widely publicized calls for boycott of 2016 Academy Awards ceremony; board says its goal is to double number of female and minority members by 2020.
